intro: Montanoa samalensis, commonly known as the Mexican mountain mallow, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. It produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. Montanoa samalensis is often found in moist, shaded habitats in mountainous regions.
